Learn More

Material Prophecies: Craft as Divination opens February 20. 

Learn More

See Sanctuaries in our Mezzanine Gallery through January 17.

Learn More

Exhibitions

Opening February 20, 2026 Material Prophecies: Craft as Divination

This group exhibition features artists turn to craft to divine memory, enact ritual, and seek knowledge of the future.

Through February 28, 2026 Sanctuaries

Sanctuaries is a group exhibition where artists expound the meaning and imagination of the true and metaphysical sanctuaries that co-exist as protection, agency, preservation, and healing.

  Get the Catalogue: From the Ground Up

Edited by exhibition curator Irene Georgia Tsatsos, contributors include Olivia Chumacero, Sean C. Lahmeyer, Hillary Mushkin, Enid Baxter Ryce, and David Delgado Shorter, PhD.

  K-12 Exhibition Field Trips

From the Ground Up field trips are booking now. Every student makes an artwork related to the exhibition's themes that they can take home.

Events

2026 Spring Benefit March 28, 2026
6:00 PM - 9:00 PM

Tickets and sponsor packages are now available. Read more.

Join Our Email List

Be the first to know about upcoming Armory events. Join our email list and receive monthly updates about classes, panel discussions, performances, celebrations, and more.

Become a Member

Your support fuels our mission to provide innovative community-based arts education and contemporary art exhibitions to our community.

3:15 PM

Invent a character based on this single word: HOPE. Your character will personify HOPE. Your character is HOPE. Once you create your character, take several selfies until you capture an image that truly personifies your character's spirit.

Read more.

Artful Connections With Math: The Art Store April 09, 2020
2:58 PM

For 2nd & 3rd Graders: How do artists purchase materials for creating a project? This lesson a goal is for students to work within a given budget, create proposals, purchase materials from a classroom “store,” and create a sculpture on a base.

Read more.

Kate Lain's Top 5: Cabin Fever Playlist April 08, 2020
4:30 PM

Armory Teaching Artist Kate Lain's Cabin Fever Playlist is a crowd-sourced list of experimental films that are currently free online. Kate started the list on March 13 for her video art students at the Armory once classes were canceled due to shelter in place recommendations.

Read more.

Artful Connections With Math: Area Perimeter Blueprint Collage April 03, 2020
4:31 PM

For 3rd Graders: How do we use math and art to represent our living spaces? This lesson’s goal is for students to create a floor plan collage, using graph paper to calculate area and sewing with embroidery floss to calculate perimeter.

Read more.
